revised_title: Diffraction Effects in Intermediate Plagioclase Felspars: A Theoretical Approach
tldr: This article explains the diffraction effects in intermediate plagioclase felspars by proposing an ideal structure with stacking faults. The positions and intensities of the anomalous maxima are explained using classical diffraction theory, without making assumptions about atomic arrangements. The study covers a range of compositions between anorthite and albite, providing insights into the structure and properties of these materials.
